intro: Canthium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an erect annual herb with alternate, ovate leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathium structures, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
